pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.5: 45. The training rule on legal issues
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.2: a certain nun went to the nun Thullanandā and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.3: “Please come, Venerable, and resolve this legal issue.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.5: but then neither resolved it nor made any effort to do so.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.6: That nun told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.10: agree to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolve it nor make any effort to do so?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.11: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā acted like this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.16: “How could the nun Thullanandā act like this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.20: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.21.1: ‘If, when asked by a nun, a nun consents to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolves it nor makes any effort to resolve it, then, if there was no obstruction, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.8: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.11: Then, if there was no obstruction:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.14: she does not resolve it herself.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.15: Nor makes any effort to resolve it:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.16: she does not ask anyone else.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.17: If, thinking, “I’ll neither resolve it nor make any effort to resolve it,” then, by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.4: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.5: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.3: if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to settle it;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.8: The fifth training rule is finished.
